title: Elderships of Lithuania
text:
A seniūnija (in English: eldership, elderate, ward, parish, or subdistrict) is the smallest <a href="Subdivisions%20of%20Lithuania">administrative division</a> of <a href="Lithuania">Lithuania</a>. An eldership may comprise a very small <a href="region">region</a> consisting of few <a href="village">village</a>s, one single <a href="town">town</a>, or a part of a big <a href="city">city</a>. Elderships vary in size and population depending on their location and nature. A few elderships make up a <a href="municipality">municipality</a>. <a href="%C5%A0ilainiai">Šilainiai</a> (Kaunas) and <a href="Dainava%20%28Kaunas%29">Dainava (Kaunas)</a> are the most populous elderates, with population counts over , exceeding the population of some entire municipalities.
Elderships manage small-scale local matters, such as repairing pavements and dirt roads, and keep records on all families living in the eldership. The premise of the concept is that - unlike in higher administrative divisions - an <a href="Elder%20%28administrative%20title%29">elder</a> (the <a href="leader">leader</a> of the eldership) could have time to talk to every person in the eldership who wants to.
Modern Lithuania is divided into <a href="Counties%20of%20Lithuania">10 counties</a>, <a href="List%20of%20municipalities%20of%20Lithuania">60 municipalities</a>, and 546 elderships. Elderships function as municipal districts. In cities, an elder is elected to each eldership district, along with a mayor for the city.
Note: historically the term referred to significantly larger administrative units, e.g. <a href="Eldership%20of%20Samogitia">Eldership of Samogitia</a> (also known for a longer period of history as the Duchy of Samogitia).
